issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Impersonation does not work if standby RM is contacted first

comments.body: I've narrowed down the source of the issue.  {{RMProxy#getProxy}} has a {{doAs}} block to create a {{YarnRPC}} using {{UserGroupInformation.getCurrentUser()}} to get the UGI.  The normal pattern of a Hadoop client is to do a {{doAs}} block when creating the client, and then all subsequent calls to that client should happen with that UGI, even if it's used outside of a {{doAs}}.  {{RMProxy#getProxy}} is getting called when submitting the application in the case where the client first hits the standby RM so that it can try the next RM, but not in the case where it hits the active RM first.  So when that happens, {{UserGroupInformation.getCurrentUser()}} returns the oozie user instead of the impersonated user because submitting the application is done outside of a {{doAs}} block.

The 001 patch:
- Fixes the problem by making {{RMProxy}} ({{ClientRMProxy}} and {{ServerRMProxy}}) no longer singleton instances so we can store the current UGI when they're created, and then use it when creating the RPC in {{RMProxy#getProxy}}
- Removes a deprecated method from {{RMProxy}} (deprecated in Hadoop 2.3.0)
- Adds a test that verifies that the proxy user (impersonation) works correctly

I've also verified that Oozie on Yarn and the Hadoop CLI are able to submit jobs correctly on both a secure and non-secure cluster.

The patch looks good to me. One minor comment: RMProxy.user can be private?

[~jianhe] - Can you please take a look at this as well? Robert and I debated multiple approaches and agreed this is the simplest and safest change.
Thanks [~kasha].  Checkstyle actually complained about that already :)

The 002 patch
- Fixes the (relevant) checkstyle warnings, including making {{RMProxy.user}} private.

This message was automatically generated.

+1 on the latest patch. Let us wait for a day or two for [~jianhe] or others to review/comment.

Just to call out for anyone looking at the patch: This patch will lead to not re-using the proxy object among multiple users. We don't anticipate that to be a major problem.
In fact, you wouldn't want to re-use the proxy object among multiple users; unless you want userA to unknowingly submit things as userB :)
Patch looks good to me too. Thanks !

Thanks [~kasha] and [~jianhe] for reviews.  Committed to trunk and branch-2!

I had to make a variable {{final}} due to an inner class in a test method because of branch-2, but it seemed trivial enough and the test still passed so I figured it was okay to change it when committing without going through another round of reviewing.
